thread.title: The Super-Bowl-Watching Nuns Are Back And As Entertaining As Ever
thread.title_full: The Super-Bowl-Watching Nuns Are Back And As Entertaining As Ever

author: Andy McDonald
title: The Super-Bowl-Watching Nuns Are Back And As Entertaining As Ever
text:
The Super-Bowl-Watching Nuns Are Back And As Entertaining As Ever Best Twitter feed of the night. 02/05/2017 10:56 pm ET Andy McDonald Comedy Writer / Editor, The Huffington Post 
During last year‚Äôs Super Bowl , we discovered the Twitter feed of Sister Miriam James , a nun from the Society of Our Lady of the Most Holy Trinity in New Mexico. 
Her play-by-play narrative of the Super Bowl (as told through the funny reaction shots of fellow nun and football fanatic Sister Mary) was our favorite part of the big game in 2016. 
Well, Sister Miriam and Sister Mary were back for Super Bowl LI, and they‚Äôve taken a short break from doing God‚Äôs work to ... well, do God‚Äôs less important but perhaps more entertaining work. 
They did not disappoint. Sr Mary prepares her super-secret-recipe chili for #SuperBowlSunday (no one knows how it's made! No one!!!) üèàüôä pic.twitter.com/hpLqYeOijr ‚Äî Sr. Miriam James (@onegroovynun) February 5, 2017 Sr Mary sings along with #AmericaTheBeautiful (not even lip syncing!) #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/SO49ohPAuk ‚Äî Sr. Miriam James (@onegroovynun) February 5, 2017 Matt Ryan gives Sr Mary one more look before he and the #Falcons win the #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/VtInuzyLVV ‚Äî Sr. Miriam James (@onegroovynun) February 5, 2017 Someone DNA test #Brady to see if he's human. I still think he's a cyborg posing as a human. ü§ñ #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/YI7s4G8U80 ‚Äî Sr. Miriam James (@onegroovynun) February 5, 2017 Sr Mary is a Belieber #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/ht4LTEP4tY ‚Äî Sr. Miriam James (@onegroovynun) February 6, 2017 Think that guy borrowed Sr Mary's flannel. #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/rsk0jvuueU
